org.mt4j.util.math
Class ToolsGeometry

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.util.math.ToolsGeometry

public class ToolsGeometry
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of geometry related static helper methods.

static boolean RaySphere(Vector3D p1, Vector3D p2, Vector3D sc, float r)
          http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/sphereline/raysphere.c Calculate the intersection of a ray and a sphere The line segment is defined from p1 to p2 The sphere is of radius r and centered at sc There are potentially two points of intersection given by p = p1 + mu1 (p2 - p1) p = p1 + mu2 (p2 - p1) Return FALSE if the ray doesn't intersect the sphere.

Parameters:

planePoint1 - the plane point1
planePoint2 - the plane point2
planePoint3 - the plane point3
Returns:
the ray plane intersection the intersection point or 'null' if there is not intersection

getRayTriangleIntersection

public static Vector3D getRayTriangleIntersection(Ray R,
                                                  Vector3D t0,
                                                  Vector3D t1,
                                                  Vector3D t2)
Tests if the given ray intersects a triangle specified by the three given vector points. Returns the intersection point or null if there is none.

Parameters:
R - the r
t0 - the t0
t1 - the t1
t2 - the t2
Returns:
the ray triangle intersection the intersection point

getRayTriangleIntersection

public static Vector3D getRayTriangleIntersection(Ray R,
                                                  Vector3D t0,
                                                  Vector3D t1,
                                                  Vector3D t2,
                                                  Vector3D n)
Tests if the given ray intersects a triangle specified by the three given vector points. Returns the intersection point or null if there is none.
This method uses the provided triangle normal vector for speeding things up so the normal doesent have to be computed again if its already cached somewhere.

Note: The provided normal vector should NOT be normalized! (For detection of degenerate triangles)

Parameters:
R - the r
t0 - the t0
t1 - the t1
t2 - the t2
n - the triangles normal vector
Returns:
the ray triangle intersection

isMeshesIntersecting

public static boolean isMeshesIntersecting(MTTriangleMesh mesh1,
                                           MTTriangleMesh mesh2)
This is a VERY brute force method of detecting if two MTTriangleMesh objects intersect.

Parameters:
mesh1 - The first TriMesh.
mesh2 - The second TriMesh.
Returns:
True if they intersect, false otherwise.

isTrianglesIntersect

public static boolean isTrianglesIntersect(Vector3D v0,
                                           Vector3D v1,
                                           Vector3D v2,
                                           Vector3D u0,
                                           Vector3D u1,
                                           Vector3D u2)
This method tests for the intersection between two triangles defined by their vertexes. Converted to java from C code found at http://www.acm.org/jgt/papers/Moller97/tritri.html

Parameters:
v0 - First triangle's first vertex.
v1 - First triangle's second vertex.
v2 - First triangle's third vertex.
u0 - Second triangle's first vertex.
u1 - Second triangle's second vertex.
u2 - Second triangle's third vertex.
Returns:
True if the two triangles intersect, false otherwise.

                                      Vector3D aEnd,
                                      Vector3D bBegin,
                                      Vector3D bEnd,
                                      Vector3D theIntersection)

getShortestDistanceBetweenLines

public static boolean getShortestDistanceBetweenLines(Vector3D p1,
                                                      Vector3D p2,
                                                      Vector3D p3,
                                                      Vector3D p4,
                                                      Vector3D pa,
                                                      Vector3D pb,
                                                      float[] theResult)
Gets the shortest distance between lines. from paul bourke ( http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/lineline3d/ ) Calculate the line segment PaPb that is the shortest route between two lines P1P2 and P3P4. Calculate also the values of mua and mub where Pa = P1 + mua (P2 - P1) Pb = P3 + mub (P4 - P3) Return FALSE if no solution exists.

Parameters:
p1 - the p1 line 1 point1
p2 - the p2 line 1 point2
p3 - the p3 line 2 point1
p4 - the p4 line 2 point2
pa - the pa a not null vector that will be filled with the first point if the shortest distance line
pb - the pb a not null vector that will be filled with the 2nd point if the shortest distance line
theResult - the result - a float[2] array
Returns:
the shortest distance between lines

                                             Vector3D theLineStart,

DistancePointLine Unit Test Copyright (c) 2002, All rights reserved Damian Coventry Tuesday, 16 July 2002 Implementation of theory by Paul Bourke

RaySphere

public static boolean RaySphere(Vector3D p1,
                                Vector3D p2,
                                Vector3D sc,
                                float r)
http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/sphereline/raysphere.c Calculate the intersection of a ray and a sphere The line segment is defined from p1 to p2 The sphere is of radius r and centered at sc There are potentially two points of intersection given by p = p1 + mu1 (p2 - p1) p = p1 + mu2 (p2 - p1) Return FALSE if the ray doesn't intersect the sphere.

isPoint3DInPlanarPolygon

public static boolean isPoint3DInPlanarPolygon(Vector3D[] polygonVertices,
                                               Vector3D testPoint,
                                               Vector3D polyNormal)
Projects the polygon and and the point to check into 2D and then checks if the given point is inside the shape.
NOTE: The polygon to test has to be planar, meaning that all points must lie int the same plane in 3d space.

Parameters:
testPoint - the test point
polyNormal - the poly normal
polygonVertices - the polygon vertices
Returns:
true, if checks if is point in poly whether the testpoint is inside the planar polygon or not

Checks if the planar polygon vertices contain the point.

Parameters:
polygonPoints - the polygon points
testPoint - the test point
Returns:
true, if checks if is polygon contains point

getPolygonCenterOfMass2D

public static Vector3D getPolygonCenterOfMass2D(Vector3D[] vertices)
Returns the center of mass of the planar polygon vertices in the x,y plane.
NOTE: Use this in 2D, this only uses the x, y coordinates of the vectors!.

Parameters:
vertices - the vertices
Returns:
the polygon center of mass2 d

getPolygonArea2D

public static double getPolygonArea2D(Vector3D[] vertices)
Calculates the area of a 2D polygon using its transformed world coordinates
NOTE: Use this in 2D, this only uses the x, y coordinates of the vectors!
NOTE: works only if the last vertex is equal to the first (polygon is closed correctly). (not confirmed..)
Polygon vertices have to be declared in counter-clockwise order! (or cw..?)

Parameters:
vertices - the vertices
Returns:
the area as double

isPolygonAxisAlignedLocal

public static int isPolygonAxisAlignedLocal(MTPolygon p,
                                            float epsilon)
Checks if is polygon axis aligned. Uses the polygons local vertices to check. The result is one of the values:
AXIS_NONE, AXIS_X, AXIS_Y, AXIS_Z

Parameters:
p - the p
epsilon - the epsilon
Returns:
the int

getQuadBezierVertices

public static Vertex[] getQuadBezierVertices(Vertex curveStartP,
                                             Vertex curveControlP,
                                             Vertex curveEndP,
                                             int segmentDetail)
Calculates the vertices of a quadric bezier curve defined by the startpoint curveStartP, the controlpoint curveControlP and the end point curveEndP.
The segments parameter defines the resolution of the curve.
Note: This method uses only the X and Y Coordinates and generates a 2D curve!

Parameters:
curveStartP - the curve start p
curveControlP - the curve control p
curveEndP - the curve end p
segmentDetail - the segment detail
Returns:
the quad bezier vertices

getCubicBezierVertices

public static Vertex[] getCubicBezierVertices(float startX,
                                              float startY,
                                              float controlP1X,
                                              float controlP1Y,
                                              float controlP2X,
                                              float controlP2Y,
                                              float endX,
                                              float endY,
                                              int segments)
Calculates/Interpolates the vertices of a bezier curve defined by the startpoint p, the controlpoints b,b2 and the end point p2. The segments parameter defines the resolution of the curve

Parameters:
startX - the px0
startY - the py0
controlP1X - the bx1
controlP1Y - the by1
controlP2X - the b2x2
controlP2Y - the b2y2
endX - the p2x3
endY - the p2y3
segments - the segments
Returns:
the cubic bezier vertices

getCubicFromQuadraticCurve

public static BezierVertex getCubicFromQuadraticCurve(Vertex bezierStart,
                                                      Vertex firstQuadControlP,
                                                      Vertex quadEndPoint)
Converts the values of a quadric bezier curve into a cubic.
Returns a BezierVertex with the values of the cubic curve equivalent to the quadric curve. -> Creates 2 bezier controlpoints out of one.

Parameters:
bezierStart - the bezier start
firstQuadControlP - the first quad control p
quadEndPoint - the quad end point
Returns:
the cubic from quadratic curve

arcTo

public static java.util.List<Vertex> arcTo(float fromX1,
                                           float fromX2,
                                           float rx,
                                           float ry,
                                           float phi,
                                           boolean large_arc,
                                           boolean sweep,
                                           float x,
                                           float y,
                                           int segments)
Returns an arraylist of vertices that form the arc, built from the supplied parameters.

Parameters:
fromX1 - curve startpointX
fromX2 - curve startpointY
rx - the x radius
ry - the y radius
phi - the phi
large_arc - the large_arc
sweep - the sweep
x - the x
y - the y
segments - the resolution of the curve, more segments -> smoother curve -> less performance
Returns:
the list< vertex>
